paper.title: Planning, critical success factors, and management's information requirements
paper.publisher: Society for Information Management and The Management Information Systems Research Center
paper.abstract: Focusing on a manageru0027s goals and critical success factors has been advocated as an approach to defining senior and middle managersu0027 information requirements. In this article a field study is described in which the planning processes in a corporation were used as a mechanism for identifying goals, critical success factors and performance measures and standards, i.e., information requirements for managerial control. A general approach generated from the field study is described and the advantages and disadvantages of the approach are analyzed.
